verses.verse: For, behold, the <S%H113>Lord<s%>, the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> of <S%H6635>hosts<s%>, doth take <S%H5493>away<s%> from <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> and from <S%H3063>Judah<s%> the <S%H4937>stay<s%> and the <S%H4938>staff<s%>, the whole <S%H4937>stay<s%> of <S%H3899>bread<s%>, and the <S%H3605>whole<s%> <S%H4937>stay<s%> of <S%H4325>water<s%>,
The mighty <S%H1368>man<s%>, and the <S%H376>man<s%> of <S%H4421>war<s%>, the <S%H8199>judge<s%>, and the <S%H5030>prophet<s%>, and the <S%H7080>prudent<s%>, and the <S%H2205>ancient<s%>,

The <S%H8269>captain<s%> of <S%H2572>fifty<s%>, and the <S%H5375>honourable<s%> <S%H6440>man<s%>, and the <S%H3289>counsellor<s%>, and the <S%H2450>cunning<s%> <S%H2791>artificer<s%>, and the <S%H995>eloquent<s%> <S%H3908>orator<s%>. the honourable: Heb. a man eminent in countenance eloquent: or, skilful of speech
And I will <S%H5414>give<s%> <S%H5288>children<s%> to be their <S%H8269>princes<s%>, and <S%H8586>babes<s%> shall <S%H4910>rule<s%> over them.

And the <S%H5971>people<s%> shall be <S%H5065>oppressed<s%>, every <S%H376>one<s%> by <S%H376>another<s%>, and every <S%H376>one<s%> by his <S%H7453>neighbour<s%>: the <S%H5288>child<s%> shall behave himself <S%H7292>proudly<s%> against the <S%H2205>ancient<s%>, and the <S%H7034>base<s%> against the <S%H3513>honourable<s%>.

When a <S%H376>man<s%> shall take <S%H8610>hold<s%> of his <S%H251>brother<s%> of the <S%H1004>house<s%> of his <S%H1>father<s%>, saying, Thou hast <S%H8071>clothing<s%>, be thou our <S%H7101>ruler<s%>, and let this <S%H4384>ruin<s%> be under thy <S%H3027>hand<s%>:

In that <S%H3117>day<s%> shall he <S%H5375>swear<s%>, <S%H559>saying<s%>, I will not be an <S%H2280>healer<s%>; for in my <S%H1004>house<s%> is neither <S%H3899>bread<s%> nor <S%H8071>clothing<s%>: <S%H7760>make<s%> me not a <S%H7101>ruler<s%> of the <S%H5971>people<s%>. swear: Heb. lift up the hand healer: Heb. binder up

For <S%H3389>Jerusalem<s%> is <S%H3782>ruined<s%>, and <S%H3063>Judah<s%> is <S%H5307>fallen<s%>: because their <S%H3956>tongue<s%> and their <S%H4611>doings<s%> are against the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>, to <S%H4784>provoke<s%> the <S%H5869>eyes<s%> of his <S%H3519>glory<s%>.

The <S%H1971>shew<s%> of their <S%H6440>countenance<s%> doth witness against <S%H6030>them<s%>; and they <S%H5046>declare<s%> their <S%H2403>sin<s%> as <S%H5467>Sodom<s%>, they <S%H3582>hide<s%> it not. <S%H188>Woe<s%> unto their <S%H5315>soul<s%>! for they have <S%H1580>rewarded<s%> <S%H7451>evil<s%> unto themselves.
<S%H559>Say<s%> ye to the <S%H6662>righteous<s%>, that it shall be <S%H2896>well<s%> with him: for they shall <S%H398>eat<s%> the <S%H6529>fruit<s%> of their <S%H4611>doings<s%>.
<S%H188>Woe<s%> unto the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>! it shall be <S%H7451>ill<s%> with him: for the <S%H1576>reward<s%> of his <S%H3027>hands<s%> shall be <S%H6213>given<s%> him. given: Heb. done to him

As for my <S%H5971>people<s%>, <S%H5953>children<s%> are their <S%H5065>oppressors<s%>, and <S%H802>women<s%> <S%H4910>rule<s%> over them. O my <S%H5971>people<s%>, they which <S%H833>lead<s%> thee cause thee to <S%H8582>err<s%>, and <S%H1104>destroy<s%> the <S%H1870>way<s%> of thy <S%H734>paths<s%>. lead: or, call thee blessed destroy: Heb. swallow up
The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> standeth <S%H5324>up<s%> to <S%H7378>plead<s%>, and <S%H5975>standeth<s%> to <S%H1777>judge<s%> the <S%H5971>people<s%>.

The <S%H3068>LORD<s%> will <S%H935>enter<s%> into <S%H4941>judgment<s%> with the <S%H2205>ancients<s%> of his <S%H5971>people<s%>, and the <S%H8269>princes<s%> thereof: for ye have eaten <S%H1197>up<s%> the <S%H3754>vineyard<s%>; the <S%H1500>spoil<s%> of the <S%H6041>poor<s%> is in your <S%H1004>houses<s%>. eaten: or, burnt

What mean ye that ye <S%H1792>beat<s%> my <S%H5971>people<s%> to <S%H1792>pieces<s%>, and <S%H2912>grind<s%> the <S%H6440>faces<s%> of the <S%H6041>poor<s%>? <S%H5002>saith<s%> the <S%H136>Lord<s%> <S%H3069>GOD<s%> of <S%H6635>hosts<s%>.

Moreover the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> <S%H559>saith<s%>, <S%H3282>Because<s%> the <S%H1323>daughters<s%> of <S%H6726>Zion<s%> are <S%H1361>haughty<s%>, and <S%H3212>walk<s%> with stretched <S%H5186>forth<s%> <S%H1627>necks<s%> and <S%H8265>wanton<s%> <S%H5869>eyes<s%>, <S%H1980>walking<s%> and <S%H2952>mincing<s%> as they <S%H3212>go<s%>, and making a <S%H5913>tinkling<s%> with their <S%H7272>feet<s%>: wanton: Heb. deceiving with their eyes mincing: or, tripping nicely

Therefore the <S%H136>Lord<s%> will smite with a <S%H5596>scab<s%> the crown of the <S%H6936>head<s%> of the <S%H1323>daughters<s%> of <S%H6726>Zion<s%>, and the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> will <S%H6168>discover<s%> their secret <S%H6596>parts<s%>. discover: Heb. make naked

In that <S%H3117>day<s%> the <S%H136>Lord<s%> will take <S%H5493>away<s%> the <S%H8597>bravery<s%> of their tinkling <S%H5914>ornaments<s%> about their feet, and their <S%H7636>cauls<s%>, and their round tires like the <S%H7720>moon<s%>, cauls: or, networks
The <S%H5188>chains<s%>, and the <S%H8285>bracelets<s%>, and the <S%H7479>mufflers<s%>, chains: or, sweet balls mufflers: or, spangled ornaments

The <S%H6287>bonnets<s%>, and the ornaments of the <S%H6807>legs<s%>, and the <S%H7196>headbands<s%>, and the <S%H5315>tablets<s%> <S%H1004><s%>, and the <S%H3908>earrings<s%>, tablets: Heb. houses of the soul
The <S%H2885>rings<s%>, and <S%H639>nose<s%> <S%H5141>jewels<s%>,
The changeable suits of <S%H4254>apparel<s%>, and the <S%H4595>mantles<s%>, and the <S%H4304>wimples<s%>, and the crisping <S%H2754>pins<s%>,
The <S%H1549>glasses<s%>, and the fine <S%H5466>linen<s%>, and the <S%H6797>hoods<s%>, and the <S%H7289>vails<s%>.

And it shall come to pass, that instead of sweet <S%H1314>smell<s%> there shall be <S%H4716>stink<s%>; and instead of a <S%H2290>girdle<s%> a <S%H5364>rent<s%>; and instead of well <S%H4639>set<s%> <S%H4748>hair<s%> <S%H7144>baldness<s%>; and instead of a <S%H6614>stomacher<s%> a <S%H4228>girding<s%> of <S%H8242>sackcloth<s%>; and <S%H3587>burning<s%> instead of <S%H3308>beauty<s%>.
Thy <S%H4962>men<s%> shall <S%H5307>fall<s%> by the <S%H2719>sword<s%>, and thy <S%H1369>mighty<s%> in the <S%H4421>war<s%>. mighty: Heb. might
And her <S%H6607>gates<s%> shall <S%H578>lament<s%> and <S%H56>mourn<s%>; and she being <S%H5352>desolate<s%> shall <S%H3427>sit<s%> upon the <S%H776>ground<s%>. desolate: or, emptied: Heb. cleansed
